page.title: 15MAXTOCK GRANGE,LICHFIELD.
page.content: The farmhouse is partly Victorian and partly Georgian in design and was previously called Pleasure Farm. The farm itself consists of seventy acres and has been farmed since the 17th century. Both vegetables and fruit are grown on the farm, the vegetables being sold at the wholesale market, whilst the fruit is sold on a "pick-your-own" basis. This means that the general public pick fruit for themselves and are charged by weight. There is a farm shop within the farmyard where the public can buy produce direct instead of from a local shop. The farm is situated behind the Victoria Hospital and is typical of farms in the area producing fruit for the increasing number of people who enjoy picking their own.
